question: Question_02_(g)
statement:
Consider the function

\begin{align*}f(x) = \frac{x^{2}}{x^{2} - 4}.\end{align*} Its first and second derivatives are
given by

\begin{align*}f'(x) = -\frac{8x}{(x^{2} - 4)^{2}}, \quad f''(x) = \frac{8(3x^{2} + 4)}{(x^{2} - 4)^{3}}\end{align*}

g) Draw the graph of f(x). Accurately place all critical points and
inflection points, indicate all asymptotes, and make sure your graph
correctly shows where f(x) is increasing and decreasing and correctly
shows its concavity.
hints:
Start by collecting all the information from the previous parts onto one
graph. Then graph.
